results.title: Differential effects of enalapril and atenolol on proteinuria and renal haemodynamics in non-diabetic renal disease.
results.text_hl: Differential effects of @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ and renal haemodynamics in @DISEASE_Diabetic_Nephropathies @DISEASE_MESH:D003928 @@@non-diabetic renal disease@@@.

results.title: [Renal hemodynamics and proteinuria in chronic glomerulonephritis treated with beta-receptor blockers or ace inhibitors].
results.text_hl: Compared with the placebo, all three drugs significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ (P < 0.05): 1.8 +/- 1.3 g/24 h with placebo, 1.2 +/- 1.2 g/24 h with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 1.2 +/- 1.1 g/24 h with @CHEMICAL_Celiprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017272 @@@celiprolol@@@ and 1.4 +/- 1.4 g/24 h with @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@.

citations.NLM: Erley CM, Berger ED, Heyne N, Klass M, Krämer D, Braun N, Wolf S, Risler T. [Renal hemodynamics and proteinuria in chronic glomerulonephritis treated with beta-receptor blockers or ace inhibitors]. Dtsch Med Wochenschr. 1997 Aug 1;122(31-32):953-8. PMID: 9280714

results.title: Effects of atenolol and enalapril on kidney function in hypertensive diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: After 8 months' treatment, severity of @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ significantly decreased both in the @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@-treated group and in the group receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: De Cesaris R, Ranieri G, Filitti V, Andriani A, Bonfantino MV. Effects of atenolol and enalapril on kidney function in hypertensive diabetic patients. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1993 Aug;22(2):208-14. PMID: 7692159

results.title: Placebo-controlled trial of atenolol in treatment of pregnancy-associated hypertension.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ given once daily significantly reduced blood-pressure, prevented @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@, and reduced the number of hospital admissions.

citations.NLM: Rubin PC, Butters L, Clark DM, Reynolds B, Sumner DJ, Steedman D, Low RA, Reid JL. Placebo-controlled trial of atenolol in treatment of pregnancy-associated hypertension. Lancet. 1983 Feb 26;1(8322):431-4. PMID: 6131164

results.title: Captopril and atenolol are equally effective in retarding progression of diabetic nephropathy. Results of a 2-year prospective, randomized study.
results.text_hl: With @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ @DISEASE_Albuminuria @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@ decreased from 933 (603-1445) to 676 (437-1047) mg/24 h and @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ from 1.5 (1.0-2.4) to 0.9 (0.6-1.5) g/24 h.

citations.NLM: Elving LD, Wetzels JF, van Lier HJ, de Nobel E, Berden JH. Captopril and atenolol are equally effective in retarding progression of diabetic nephropathy. Results of a 2-year prospective, randomized study. Diabetologia. 1994 Jun;37(6):604-9. PMID: 7926346

results.title: Dissociation between blood pressure reduction and fall in proteinuria in primary renal disease: a randomized double-blind trial.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: Guidelines recommend lower threshold and goal blood pressure (BP) for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@. BP reduction could be accompanied by a different fall in @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ depending of the antihypertensive drug.

citations.NLM: PROCOPA Study Group. Dissociation between blood pressure reduction and fall in proteinuria in primary renal disease: a randomized double-blind trial. J Hypertens. 2002 Apr;20(4):729-37. PMID: 11910310

results.title: Randomized controlled trial of ACE-inhibitors and beta-blockers with and without vasodilating activity in chronic glomerulonephritis.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@Proteinuria@@@ was significantly (p < 0.05) reduced compared to placebo by all 3 drugs (1.8 +/- 1.3 g/24 h under placebo, 1.2 +/- 1.2 g/24 h under @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 1.2 +/- 1.1 g/24 h under @CHEMICAL_Celiprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017272 @@@celiprolol@@@, and 1.4 +/- 1.4 g/24 h under @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@).

citations.NLM: Erley CM, Klass M, Krämer D, Berger E, Heyne N, Braun N, Wolf S, Risler T. Randomized controlled trial of ACE-inhibitors and beta-blockers with and without vasodilating activity in chronic glomerulonephritis. Int J Clin Pharmacol Ther. 1996 Nov;34(11):504-9. PMID: 8937934

results.title: Comparative effects of enalapril, atenolol and chlorthalidone on blood pressure and kidney function of diabetic patients affected by arterial hypertension and persistent proteinuria.

results.title: Are angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors superior to beta blockers in retarding progressive renal function decline?
results.text_hl: Filtration fraction and @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ decreased in both groups.

results.title: Proteinuria in mild to moderate hypertension: results of the VA cooperative study of six antihypertensive agents and placebo. Department of Veterans Affairs Cooperative Study Group on Antihypertensive Agents.
results.text_hl: Eighteen @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were removed from the study during the active treatment phase for @<m>DISEASE_Proteinuria</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ > 1000 mg/24 hours: @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ 4, placebo 3, @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@ 3, @CHEMICAL_Prazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011224 @@@prazosin@@@ 3, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 2, @CHEMICAL_Clonidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003000 @@@clonidine@@@ 2, and @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ 1.

citations.NLM: Preston RA, Materson BJ, Reda DJ, Hamburger RJ, Williams DW, Smith MH. Proteinuria in mild to moderate hypertension: results of the VA cooperative study of six antihypertensive agents and placebo. Department of Veterans Affairs Cooperative Study Group on Antihypertensive Agents. Clin Nephrol. 1997 May;47(5):310-5. PMID: 9181278
